text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Likier czekoladowy, masa ciemnych owoców, przyjemny alkohol.
Портеры люблю! Это не стало исключе& Копенга& очень нравитс& Пиво вкусное

from Erzbierschof - black beer with a dark beige foam; roasted aroma of pralines, walnuts and mocha, light buttery; quite sweet; full-bodied; moderate carbonation; long chocolaty finish with some residual sweetness - really impressive

Black. Liquorice, soy and roasted barley in the aroma. Up front is a strong, spicy and highly sweet taste with caramel malt and hoppy flavours, that finish with light alcohol, burnt malt and high bitterness. Full body, and a silky smooth texture. Overall, a very good porter. This beer is big, powerful and very tasty, much like the other imperial stouts and porters from Mikkeller, but the balance is off due to the sweetness. It becomes cloying halfway through, which is a shame.
Shared bottle, poured black with a tanned head. Nose of toasted malts, caramel, syrup sticky, toffee, prunes, smoked, bacon, raisin sweetness. Smoky aftertaste

Bouteille achetée à La Mise En Bière - De couleur noire avec une fine mousse beige qui colle bien au verre - Au nez des arômes de café, de chocolat, malt torréfié, légèrement fruité et vineux, cacao, alcool, mélasse, vin cuit, bien complexe et lourd - En bouche, toujours beaucoup de chocolat et cacao, puissant, terreux, vin cuit, beaucoup dalcool, café - Corp puissant, amertume forte, carbonation correcte, soyeuse, final chocolat alcool puissant - Cest puissant presque trop, sinon cest complexe, mais trop de chose a la fois
Bottle at home. Pours black, nose is smoky bacon, roasted, chocolate, taste is similar, rich, liquorice.
Dunkler, vollmundig malziger Antrunk. Noten von Schokolade und Vanille, holzig, süßlich nach Whisky. Unsüffig, dennoch rund. Gut. 11/10/9/11/10/11

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: intensive roasted malt with coffee and chocolate notes. Superb construction. Very intensive. Taste: full body with roasted malt, caramel and coffee intensive finish. Very nice beer, good attenuation and quiet drinkable. Aftertaste: coffee and roasted malt. Small alcohol finish.

Bottled. A black beer with a lazing dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, and dark bitter chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of bitter chocolate, roasted malt, bread, and alcohol, leading to a bitter finish.
Black, tan long-lasting head. Elderberry, syrup, very intense, alcohol. Taste is smoky, sweet, wood flavors, top class! Dry, thick texture. Very good for experimenting in the style.

330ml bottle, vertical with BA Bourbon. Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, salty licorice, hints of coffee, chocolate, cocoa, rubbery notes. Taste is smooth, sweet and salty with loads of licorice, hints of syrup, coffee and chocolate. Finish is smooth, heavy, sweetish and salty with loads of licorice, hints of syrup. Quite heavy.

33 cl bottle @ home
Vertical with Brian BA
Aroma is somewhat mild but still pleasant with vanilla and licorice. Flavour has somewhat salty licorice and mild herbal tones. Somewhat simple(!) but works.

I stort sett svart öl med ett större ljusbrunt skum som ligger kvar länge. Doften har mycket malt, bränt socker, mörk choklad, trä och alkoholsötma.
I smaken tillkommer kaffe och lakrits.

Bottle. A birthday gift from Pix. Cheers! Pours inky black with a big foamy beige head. Aroma of dark demerera sugar. The taste is sweet with rich treacle flavour. Theres some slightly sour fruitiness to it as well. This finish is bitter and lingering. Oily texture. Great beer.
UPDATED: MAR 1, 2016 Pours black color, nearly no head. Smells olives. Sweet, roasted malts, some sour notes. Full-bodied, petfect carbonation. Perfect brew for the stile.

pours oily black with a large creamy dark beige head, sticky lacing. roasted umami maltiness, lots of salty milk chocolate, gently smoked woodsy malts, red fruits - jammy with a zingy tartness; molasses and raisin sweetness, perfumey alcohol - without being boozy, tobacco, few pine needles, salt, other minerals. low carbonation semi-sweet yet assertive earthy-woodsy finish.very solid imperial porter. much enjoyed!

the aroma of roasted malt and caramel with hints of smoke, toffee, vanilla, black chocolate, dark fruits and port... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of toast, dark fruits, red wine, bitter chocolate, toffee and vanilla... sweet, dry and warming aftertaste...

Apr. 15. A 0.33 l bottle from Ivana Trgovina shop, Split. It poured a pitch black body with quite a big brown hued head. Roasted malt ruled the aroma, chicory, coffee... Also fruity, plum jam and light orange. Flavor was sweet, a bit too much, but complex just like the aroma. Basically, a palette of roasted malt flavors ranging from bitter to sweet creamy intertwined with pine and peppery hops. Full body with nice chocolate, cocoa and coffee finish, still with that hoppy note. Reading the other reviews I have a feeling this varies, too, for this one Marko and me had I can only add if only it were a bit less sweet.

2015-08-21
Sweet liqueur, coffee, dark fruits, only light roast, breadiness, light sourness. Great!

330 ml bottle. Pours black with a resilient dark beige head. Aroma is brown sugar, burnt, toast, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is brown sugar, ash, roast, red and dark berries. Finish is coffee, chocolate, light booze, burnt caramel. Lingering fig, dates, tobacco. Full body, velvety and oily mouthfeel, weak to average carbonation.
Thick slick gloosy sticky black with a big beaming rocky rich tan head. Rich and full bodied on the palate with plenty of telatively full on balanced sweetness and mocha chocolate. Very good.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2017 Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with medium, medium brown, semi-densed head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is sweet (brown sugar, caramel), some roasted malts (mainly cocoa), also some vanilla and hazelnut notes, pretty noticable booze. Secondly very nice, impressive moderate dark fruits aromas - plums, raisins, cherries in chocolate. Taste is semi-sweet with quite strong bittery notes from the middle of drinking. Full body, oily texture,medium carbonation finish is quietly astringent, fruity, slightly roasted and semi-bitter. In overall quite impressive imperial porter with impressive dark fruit notes.

330 ml bottle from Gallaghers Beer World/El Irlandés. Pours a murky, viscous black color with a big gray-ish tan head that lasts long and leaves a lingering 1/2 finger cap. Poweful and intense aroma felt even before sniffing. Roasted malts mixed up with lively hoppy hints and some charcoal character. Notes of bitter chocolate, cacao, tar, tabacco leaves, ashes, roasted grains, prunes, lactose and molasses. Potent woody and vanilla touches round up a massive aroma. Incredible nose! -- Strong sweet taste, and Im drinking this cold. No bitterness at all with just mild roastiness offered as a counterbalance. Flavors of brown sugar, whisky cream, molasses, beetroot, stevia, chocolate liquor in an all-sweet assault. Touches of coffee and hot chocolate with sweetened cocoa. Extreme but maybe too sweet to be really good. Difficult to finish the whole bottle. Later sips become cloying. Oh! just give me a good Pilsener now! Huge body, chewy mouthfeel. Smooth and creamy. Light carbonation. No clear alcoholic presence but this warms you up a lot. Aftertaste reveals some hops but most of them appear through retronasal. Overall this is a massive Imperial Porter, huge complex smell, gigantic body, intense taste... but too sweet for me. Too bad Brian Nielsen never defeated Evander Holyfield or Mike Tyson. And for sure [Mikkeller] George! [Foreman] is completely out of his league.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2017 Pours black, haze, with big creamy light brown head. Visualy soft carbonation with slow up rising bubbles, which are so small, that you can see them only through microscope.
Aroma is marvellus: rich, malty, with coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate and with slightly burnt like character, with note of molasses, and with fruity esters of reisins, prunes. 
Flavor is also very intense, malty, with fruity esters and with bitterness: intense maltiness with coffee, dark chocolate like character, with intense note of fruity esters (plums, cherries, prunes), with slightly burnt grain, supporting molasses, and with surprisingly high hop bitterness in finish. Finish is, as I said, bitter, sticky/dry.
Malt sweetness is moderate high, hop bitterness also, body is full, sticky, silky velvet, carbonation is low.
I was afraid that Brian will be too weak opponent to George, but luckily I was wrong.

Bottle. Pours black with a creamy beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, some roasted notes, nuts and chocolate. Flavor is sweet and malty with some coffee, chocolate, caramel, some roasted notes and berries. Medium body, average carbonation.

33cl bottle shared at CBC CW, London. Thanks to Daniel. It pours a dark brown color with a large tan head. Aroma is quite sweet with notes of raisins and dark fruit, and smokey with ashes and earth. Taste is quite sweet again, with more notes of dark fruits, caramel, toffee, and lightly earhy and dry with ashes, cocoa powder. Full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, decent

330 ml bottle poured into a Bruery tulip. Black with just a thin tan ring of head. Aromas of dark chocolate, booze, roasty notes. Tastes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee, a little oak-like note, some dark fruit, some booze, touch of vanilla. Full body with a dry finish.
The aroma is super complex, coffee, smoke, chocolate, and yes cola. The flavour has been well balanced, but there is still that faint cola edge. Its a decent beer, but not one of mikkellers best
Bottle. Pours a pitch black body with a beige head. Low carbonation. Notes of chocolate, coffee, cola, and a bit of sourness.

Bottle. Pours thick pitch black with light beige head. Aroma is packed with raisins and some soy. Sweet dark fruits, malts, burnt bread, scary, slight salty, fruity port grapes, cola and sherry. Taste is really nice, roasty malts, dark fruits, light acidic, slight soy, some meaty notes. Packed with chocolate and cocoa, port. Long dry roasty finish. No sight of SBV. Some sweet red apples.

Bottle consumed at Cropredy, Fairports Annual Reunion Festival 2015 Friday 14th. Black and oily with a tan head. Rich, some treacle, bitter and roasty aftertaste, liquorice and bitter cocoa powder. Quite good.   A66 A4 T8 P4 Ov14 3.6

Bottle, at LAutre Oeil, dark black color, with a dark tan-colored head, with a sweet chocolate, fruity yeast, faint smoked bacon nose with some sweet burnt dark dried fruit, molasses, faint roasted, chocolate, black, toasted malty accents, and a burnt fruitcake, coffee, burnt brownie note in the aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate, with a warmth sweet roasted, black, chocolate, toasted malty, molasses, roasted ground coffee bean character, with some burnt toast, pruney, burnt raisin pie crust, flowery leafy, grassy hoppy flavours, leading towards a warning sweet roasted, black maltiness, lingering coffeeish, dark bitter chocolatey finish.

Bottle; pours nearly black with a mocha colored head; sweet aroma with chocolate, molasses, and dark fruits with coffee and alcohol; taste is bittersweet with chocolate, dark fruits, molasses, coffee, and hints of booze; short finish lightly bitter finish with coffee and alcohol notes; delicious

Bottle 0.33 from Svijet Piva, Zagreb. Dark liquid with small tan head. Full body, light carbonation. Light roasted with a hint of sourness in aroma. Very sweet, almost no alcohol in taste. Coffee taste, a hint of smoke and sourness.
Bottle, 330 ml at Svijet Piva, shared with JFK10000. Pours dark brown with huge dense brown head. Very sweet, chocolate, roasted malts, licorice and something lime acidic. Full bodied.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2016 Black color, thin brown head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, cocoa, herbs. Taste is similar with addition of some tarty fruitiness. Alcohol is nicely hidden. Long cocoa and coffee aftertaste. Excellent stuff.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle. Thick black pour with a large dark brown head. Molasses, sugar, chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, chalk in the nose. Thick mouthfeel, syrup, roasted malt, vanilla, wood, bark, dark dried fruits. Medium body, sticky texture, heavy sweet and bitter. Sugary and roasted finish. Sugary without much depth, heavy and difficult to drink.

Pour pitch black extremely thick and oily with minimal brown head. Epic dark chocolate and cocoa aroma. First sip and its like cocoa bomb exploded in my mouth. Slightly sweet and boozy. Full bodied, flat carbonation. This is wonderful. //svijet piva

33 cl bottle. Pours deep black with thick sugar brown foam. Good retention. Nose is complex and hoppy - hops, liquorice, brown sugar and coffee. Thick mouthfeel, strong alcohol and a profound hoppy bitterness. Chocolate, malt, dark bread, sugar sirup, plumbs, raisins and citrus Love it
Bottle a black colored beer with a brown head malts spicy citrus fruits some caramel coffee pineapple and hops flavor roasted malts spicy citrus fruits coffee some caramel and bitter hops
330ml bottle. Pours black with large tan head. Aroma is rich dark fruits and roast malts. Taste is oily with plums and figs, booze, liquorice and wood. Very decent and went down a little too well.

Bottle at S&G Mikkeller tasting.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small stable beige head.
NOSE: sweet, chocolate, port, coffee.
TASTE: sweet, chocolate, port, coffee, balanced, bitter.

Big black beer with a big tan lacing head. Massive roasted flavours, thick malty sweetness... plums, figs, treacle... brown sugar. All the good stuff youd expect from an imperial porter, and done impeccably. Great beer.

Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell. Black, big foamy tan head. Aroma is coffee, flowers, ash, light pine. Body is medium, smooth, low carbonation. Taste is smooth toffee malts, coffee, pine, finishes dry, ashy and astringent with a little pepper. Ill admit that I was highly inebriated at this stage of the night, but I thought it was very good.

Bottle thanks to Danny. It pours jet black with a small tan head. The nose is charred wood, rich roast, cocoa, juicy plum, berry and raisin. The taste is bitter-sweet, charred roast, burnt toffee, rather oily, big hit of alcohol, plum, prune, date, cocoa and some candied fruits. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. A bit rough around the edges. Not quite what I was hoping for.

Bottle split at the 9.49 CBC boost tasting, Clerko, 03/06/15 thanks to Daniel.
Pitch black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is charr, roast malt, earthy tones, spice, burnt toffee, hop notes.
Taste comprises dark chocolate, charr, spice, biscuit, earthy cocoa rub, light wood effect.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a warming booze streak.
Solid impy.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - big thanks to Daniel. Pours oily black with a foamy tan head. Lots of burnt wood on the nose, dark chocolate, smoke, cocoa. Medium sweet flavor, lots of dark fruits, oily chocolate, earthy hops. Full bodied, chewy, with fine carbonation. Heavily oily finish, more ripe dark fruits, chocolate, earth, cocoa. Pretty punchy. Sits heavy on the palate.

Bottle shared at craft beer co clerko. Opaque black mahogany brown coloured pour with a thin fading sticky creamy head. Aroma is a little meaty, mellow roast, little raspberry. flavour is composed of choc and raspberry ripple, woody. Palate is sticky sweet raspberry woody, lowish carbonation .

Bottle: Chouffe glass:
Nice thick, foamy sound when pouring this beer into my glass.
Black beer with a brown head.
Massive roast and chocolate. Or chocolate and roast... Quite remarkable is a very fine crispy hop odor that comes through between the two dark heavyweights out of the depth and makes it a great aroma! Of course theres some coffee and liquorice, but the roast and are stronger present, so they deserve to be mentioned first!
Flavour is beautiful clean dark essential trip of layers of darkness: coffee, chocolate, roast, malt roast, toffee, sweet ish coal, some caramel bitter, erc. etc. Nice nice!
The aftertaste mellows out the layers and bakes a cake out of it. Coffee, roast, chocolate, malts roat and a light bitterness. Even some light sweet tones to be found back in both favour and aftertaste.
Carbonation is low, thick rich oily mouthfeel and close to full bodied if not already entering the full body champignonship!
Dangerously easy drinkable for 12.3%ABV! Very very well done!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle - 330ml. Thick, opaque, black body with low carbonation and an average beige foamy head. Well balanced malty/hoppy aroma with roasty, brown sugar, and cocoa hints. Alcohol is perfectly hidden. Its awesome, complex, robust malty/hoppy taste carries oaky, vineous, liquorice, and brandy notes. Alcohol is not agressive at all. Ends with a long, strong, warming bittersweet finish. A homerun.

330 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Pitch black body, with a big, quite unstable, creamy, dark brown head.
Aroma of cocoa, dark chocolate, hazelnut, coffee, some liquorice.
Very pleasant, smooth taste of hazelnut, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, liquorice, some ash, some vanilla.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes roasty-bitter, a bit sweet, a bit alcohol warming, with liquorice, coffee, cocoa, slight smoke.

Very tasty! I really like the chocolate and hazelnut like notes, sweet, but also strong and roasty, with a quite rough finish. Great balance, drinks very smooth, alcohol is very well hidden. Overall not my favourite Imperial Porter, but surely among the best Ive had.
Bottle at home. Black beer with a beige head. Chocolate, coffee, vanilla and a bit fruity aroma. Coffee, chocolate, dark fruits flavour with some tar notes. A really nice one :-)
Bottle at home. Black body with a small brown head. Dark Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, bitter. Creamy mouthfeel which turns dry beacuse of the chocolate taste..

330 ml. bottle. Thanks Nikos! Pours black with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, chocolate, and coffee. Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, molasses, and alcohol. A touch of bitterness time, but still an excellent sipper.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Stas & Vova. Brown-black with a big tan and creamy head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate and roast. Taste of sweet malt, coffee, ash, berries, soy, dried fruits, light tartness, alcoholic warmth, nice bitterness. Rather full bodied. Great.

330ml bottle at home. Black color with nice creamy frothy brown head. Aroma is roasted malty, spicy like having chili peepers, cocoa, some bready and soy sauce notes, light chocolate and coffee, light berry fruity. Taste is sweet and heavy biter like aroma, more coffee in the taste and more fruity. Dark chocolate, bready malty and some caramel, light spicy. Medium creamy body with soft carbonation

UPDATED: APR 16, 2015 Bottle - thanks bursprak! Pours opaque black with a medium creamy brown head that dissipates leaving nice lacing. Aroma is rich roasty chocolate, anise, molasses. Flavor is light plus sweet, medium bitter, roasty, cocoa and molasses, a touch of soy, rich. Full body, creamy mouthfeel. Quite good, but it gets a bit strained after a whle.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks Stas & Vova. Black with a brown head. Sourish berries, a little sugary, mild tamari sauce aroma, mild bitterness, berries, some vinegar but mostly sweet taste. Smooth, no carbonation, full body, some vanilla finish.

Bottle. Black and quite lively on opening. Liquorice and chocolate combine to produce a high alcohol presence. Full bodies as you would expect but quite well balanced. Very strong mouth feel but easy to drink considering its strength.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Yoavs place. Thanks Stas & Vova. Black with a lovely big brown head. Heavily roasty aroma with coffee, sourish fruits, a bit of licorice, soy sauce, and some alcohol. Sweetish-sourish flavor with fruits, dark chocolate, coffee, soy sauce, and a smoky note in a drier bitter finish. Full-bodied. Great stuff. A bit like chocolate with sour cherries and a smoky edge.

Whee, huge thanks to heavy for sharing this! This makes tar seem pale in comparison. Blaaaack. Medium sized brown-ochre head that went away slowly. Heavy, sweet aroma, plums, raisins, coffee, huge maltiness, very very light agrumes. Taste... wow. This is sweeet, just slightly too sweet, it shows, however, at the same time, enormous potential and very good flavors - Roasty, piney/herbal/sweet agrumey hops mixing with that strong maltiness. Its definitely a very good beer, and would be a brilliant one less sweet.

Bouteille 330ml, gracieuseté de SlovakSniper, merci Pat! Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka riche et tenace laissant une épaisse dentelle. Arôme dagrumes, touche dalcool, houblon, chocolat noir, malt torréfié, cendré. Goût de malt torréfié, chocolat noir, légère acidité, houblon fruité, sucré, café en fin de bouche, épicé légère en arrière-goût. Carbonatation élevée, corps moyen-dense.

Thanks to Natalie, Nick, Nigel, Ed, Leanne, Nicola and Dave for providing context to this beer. Vote Brian? To be honest, yes. Its very dark with a small light brown head. Pours like paint from a tin and the texture is thick and glossy - low carb. Aroma isnt the usual coffee and chocolate blend - there is soy in there, vegetables, herbs. There is bitterness in the taste though, and an underlying sweetness that counteracts the alcohol content. Its smooth and balanced with dark chocolate, dark malts, black fruits and espresso coffee flavours. I feared this might be all bluster and power - there is subtlety and seduction in there too.

21 mars '15
-->Imperial Porter noire, 12.3%, 330ml
-noir absolue; mousse riche beige
-nez café corsé, toast brûlée, tourbe
-entrée liquoreuse, réglisse, mélasse
-ronde (riche); ne fait pas son %
-finale fruits (rouge), sucrée, torréfaction (café corsé); sèche et amère (persistante)
Co=4 Arô=3 Am=3.5 Su=3 Arr-g=3 Ac=1.5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Noire. Beau collet beige gris. Nez: café. Espresso. Cendre. Grain torréfié. Fumé. Bouche: liquoreuse. Riche. Grasse. Sucré. Réglisse. Café espresso. Chocolat. Très légère acidité. Vineuse (vin rouge). Choco balsamique. Belle amertume. Ne fait pas son pourcentage. Fruité. Cerise/framboise. Complexe. J'aime beaucoup.

14/II/15 - 33cl bottle @ RBBWG IV (Beerlover_Bens place) - BB: n/a (2015-221) Thanks to Beerlover_Ben for sharing the bottle!
Little hazy brown to black beer, brown creamy head, bit adhesive. Aroma: sweet, bit cheesy, resinous hops. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of mocha, coffee bitterness, bit piny, hoppy, sugary, sweet, alcohol, yeasty touch, bit sweet. Aftertaste: bitter hops, bit of alcohol, roasted. Ok, but not superb...
Очень крепкий портер, насыщен& темно-ко цвет, на вкус густой, сладков&

BOTTLE 33 CL. Wow! A huge noble bitter chocolate aroma, a touch of alcohol, but... also quite hoppy with grassy and lemon peel german hop notes. Big chocolaty flavour, sweet, yet balanced, thick as engine oil, soft spicy bitterness. With all the big things going on, the beer is well balanced and delicate.

Fonefan 300814. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, licorice, coffee, soy sauce, chocolate. Flavour is soy sauce, licorice, coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol. Full body. Very nice beer.

Thanks to Beerlover_Ben! 330 ml. bottle sampled @ RBBWG IV. Black, little mocha head. Sweet mocha, liquorish, sugar, herbal sweet nose, light umami. Taste is bitter herbal, mocha, herbal coffee, malts, brown sugar, strong lots of sugar & liquorish. Roast. Medium bodied. Very nice & distinct RIS / Imperial Porter.

Bottle @ RBBWG 2015 shared by beerlover_ben. Jet black color, smal brown head. Smell and taste malts, strongly dark chocolate, mocha, light to moderately roasty, bitter. Thick texture, medium to full body, medium carbonation. Lovely beer.
Bottle at RBBWG shared by beerlover_ben. Pours black with beige head. Aroma is chocolate, hops, some mocha, coffee, espresso. Awese. More coffee than Michael, awesome.
Kolsvart Tjock med stort brunt skum. Doftar och smakar kaffe och choklad. Lite för söt i smaken och inte så mycket rostat tyvärr. Kan den verkligen vara på 12.3%? Tror inte det!

Pours a dark brown with a small light brown head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Not too boozy which is nice. Taste is of chocolate, caramel and light soy sauce. Good smoke. Body is medium and carbonation moderate. Sticky. Not too heavy or boozy, really drinkable. Nice!

Bottle. Pours in like oil, deep black, oily with medium tan brown head. Aroma has coffee character at first with light roasty caramel body. Taste is little bit sweetness with earthy bitterness in the after taste. Body has a thick texture, is high and has medium carbonation. Nice.

Aroma: roasted coffee, molasses, cherry, milk lemongrass, cocoa; Appearance: dark brown, large frothy head, quite stable; Taste: intense bitterness, intense sweetness, intense sourness; Palate: bitter finish, slick texture, full body, average carbonation

Robust, with plenty of alcoholic warmth and some bitterness from it too - but most from hops which are a bit astringent midway through. Was given more care than a typical Baltic Porter.

5th February 2015Opaque black - brown beer, small tan head. Palate is smooth and slightly viscous. Mild fine carbonation. Smooth dark malts, tangy - a dark fruity tang. Undertone of rich coffee. Back end has a light citric hop which balances the darkness. Finishes smooth and mildly bitter. Dark chocolate and coffee linger on. A fine RIS this and pretty drinkable for its abv, Also superior to its barrel aged derivatives

Bottle 330ml. @ The Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering 2014, TSODRBSG14. [ As Mikkeller Brian ].Clear dark black brown color with a huge, creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, light brown to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, wood - calvados - apple, licorice, light chocolate and coffee, molasses notes. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, roasted, licorice, sweet malt, dark roasted, light chocolate. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140830]

Bottle 355ml. Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head, nice lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, light smokey, vegetables some alcohol. Flavor starts rather sweet, malty, chocolate, dark fruits, bitter black coffee, light smokey, earthy bitter toned and dry. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, soft but very nice carbonation. Aftertaste is ver very dry with a lingering maltyness. Hides ABV very well. A very nice imp porter but to dry for my liking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black oily pour, brownish head. Full aroma of cacao, brown malt and laurel. Taste of licorice, dark cacao, gritty coffee and a bit passion fruit. Finish is more bitter, with some fruity hops. Abv well hidden. Very tasty.
This is a masterpiece! Rich, sweet, tight. Little prunes and coffee bitterness on the finish. Hops is felt in the aftertaste. Great.

Bottle @ home. Pours jet black with a nice dark brown lacing head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate & coffee. Taste is pretty much like the nose but also with fruits, dark sugar, spices, hops and some vanilla. Nice full body and soft carbonation. It has a long roasted finish but isnt really very complex. Something weird is going on with the taste - something undefinable and sweet which I wasnt crazy about. I expected more (or something different, anyway). Next time Ill just have a George instead.
Schwarz, cremig. KAffe, Bitterschokolade, dunkler Zucker, sehr edel, Kakao, dunkle Früchte. Am Gaumen cremig, rund, dunkle Schokolade, Süße, dunkle Früchte, leicht bitter. Geil.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours jet black with medium-high brown head, diminishing. Aroma is of dark chocolate, coffee, sugar, fudge. Taste is of coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, sugar, some bitterness, hints of alcohol, fudge, slight acidity. Palate: Full bodied. Soft-medium carbonation. Sticky on the lips. Velvety. Overall: Alcohol almost hidden. Very good.

Bottle (330 ml). Split 2-ways with Minderbinder. 

Appearance: Pitch black with a medium thick dark brown head and little lacing. 

Aroma: Burst of dark chocolate followed by red fruits, burnt caramel, coffee and hints of liquorice. 

Taste: Quite milk chocolate/cocoa powder forward with burnt caramel, red fruits, coffee, light liquorice presence (it get a tad too much present as the beer breathe), vanilla and light coffee bitterness.

Palate: Full bodied. Moderate to medium carbonation. A tad oily mouthfeel. Lingering fruity finish. 

Overall: Alcohol is well hidden/integrated for a 12%+ abv beer. Balance isnt bad. Not super complex, but really flavorful. Good Porter.
Total schwarzes Bier mit einer sehr schönen braunen Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr röstmalzig, schokoladig, Vanille und Kaffee. Geschmack süß röstmalzig, schokoladig, Vanille, etwas Kaffee, sehr toll!

Bottle 33cl. Pours pitch black with a big, long lasting, brown head. Aroma has got lots of roasty malts, licorice, slight smoke, slight tobacco-ash, roasted coffee. Taste is fairly sweet up front with some burned sugar, sweet licorice and salmiak, some fruity sweet, and some savory notes. Ends off with some dry and bitter notes. Very well balanced overall. Full, sticky body and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a dark offwhite head. Aromas of cocoa, tobacco, light smoke, licorice, lots of roasted coffee, dark fresh fruits, dry wood. Taste is pretty sweet up front, dates, raisins, light smoke, licorice, dry wood, lots of roasted coffee.

Pours pitch black with a nice brown head. Aroma is roast and coffee forward. Nice and clean porter aroma. I do get a weak amount of slightly smoked malts also some dark dried fruits, sweet liquorice and some weak tobacco. Taste is nice and roasty. Lots of roasted coffee, liquorice, tobacco, some dark dried fruits, almost some ash and a savory end. A nice porter!

Bottle, bought @YNWA Beershop, Kolding. Pours completely opaque black with a lovely, large, staying, creamy beige head. Aroma has tar, roasted malts, licorice, soft smoke, light tobacco. Low carbonation, fine dry and quite oily mouthfeel. Flavour has roasted malts, chocolate, tar, cocoa, soft tobacco and smoke. Nice, even if it feels a bit rough.
Dark brown almost black and thick. Has an off-white head. Heavy sweet, roasted aroma, faint vanilla. Flavor is thick and sweet. Warming alcohol.

December 27, 2014. Bottle at home. 
Black with a small brown head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate and brown sugar. Taste is sweet sugary and milk chocolate, light bitter coffee notes. Finish is sweet dark sugars with a light roasted bitterness. Medium smooth bodied, soft carbonation.

The aroma is full of chocolate, coffee and brown sugar. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of chocolate and coffee. It feels very light on the tongue considering the high alcohol percentage. The finish is long and mild. A really good beer!

Pours black, with strong brown head. Nice look. Aroma is fruity and malty from the bottle. At first smell it feels like barley wine, has some honey notes, but after while you notice very strong roasted, cocoa and coffee background. Good balance. Taste is massively chocolate after first sip. A lot of cocoa, roasted malt and ash feeling. Great oily mouthfeel with almost completely hidden alcohol. Excellent. Bitterness in rather medium, because of well countered sweetness. Unusual...

33 cl bottle.
Pours pitch black color with a large beige head. The aroma reminds me immediately of Ashtray Heart, very ashy with some cigar notes, dark roasty malts with dry chocolate, fair amount of hops too, and some molasses. Dark chocolate and roasted malts on the flavor with ashy not and some molasses, faint honey hints as well Bitter malty palate, dry finish. Alcohol is kept at bay barely. Very heavy brew, the sweetness here is just a bit too overwhelming.
6424

UPDATED: APR 23, 2016 330 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black colour with a creamy reddish brown colour. Aroma of strong ashtray notes, some burnt bread and cacao. Flavour of strong dark roastiness, some licorice, soy sauce, burnt bread, quite strong grassy bitterness and quite strong sugary sweetness. Full bodied and oily mouthfeel. The roastiness here is brilliant, but the amount of sugary sweetness is a bit too overwhelming for me. Alcohol is very well hidden. 8-4-7-3-13 3.5 

330 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of dark roastiness, raisins and soy sauce. Flavour of rich roastiness, saltiness, grassy bitterness, floral notes and soy sauce. Full bodied. Better than the BA version. 8-4-8-4-14 3.7

Botella de 33 cl de cervezalandia tomada en el momento el 06-12-2014. Aromas frescos de maltas tostadas algo ahumadas con toques afrutados ligeramente cítricos de naranjas. Sabores de maltas tostadas, ligeramente quemadas seguido de ligeros afrutados cítricos ( mandarinas, naranjas) y herbáceos con final de Cacaos y vainillas suaves con un cuerpo denso y pastoso, con buena sensación alcohólica por sus 12.3 vol y ligero regusto amargo final perfectamente combinado con todo lo anterior y que permanece todo ello en boca por un buen rato. Recuerdos de la yuzu.... y mexas ranger solo que con mas poder alcohólico. Impresionante cerveza para repetir sin duda.

33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2014, from Mikkeller Webshop, very complex Porter, roasted/malty/bitter and slightly spicy/fruity, yet not too heavy, balanced, cloudy, rocky head, very good brew, yet expensive!

05.12.2014, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big brown creamy longlasting head. Aroma is rich and roasted, dark malts, sour coffee, licorice, dark sugar, roasted grain, dark fruits, caramel, grass. Taste is sweet kind of sour-ish, dark sugar, sour coffee, dark sour fruits, sweet licorice, grass, minerals, dark malts, burnt caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh sourish syrupy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Pours matte black with a large foam tan head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, muscovado sugar, vanilla, dry roasted malts. Taste is chocolate, coffee, muscovado sugar, roasted malts and some vanilla notes. Mouthfeel is very smooth and velvety with low carbonation.

Bottle from Bierkompass. Black beer with a rich lasting beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, grapes, citrus, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, cream, raisins, some licorice. Roasted coffee and chocolate flavor, figs, raisins, tar, some cream. Alcohol is well hidden. Nice drinkable strong porter.

It s too flat and pale, also too bitter for me. 
Probably, one of the worst mikkeller

color negro con reflejos caoba y espuma beige. Aromas con toques ahumados, tostados y frutos rojos. Cuerpo denso, textura sedosa, inicio dulce, melaza y final de amargor acafetado, inteso, tostado y seco. regusto ligeramente picante. Muy rica.

Barwa: ciemna, nieprzejrzysta nawet pod światło. Piana brązowa, obfita, ładnie oblepiająca szkło. Całość gęsta i oleista. 

Aromat: wyraźna nuta alkoholowa, nieco likierowa, wiśnie w czekoladzie, czekolada gorzka, ciemne słody oraz lekka kwaskowość. Początkowo wydaje się niezbyt odkrywczy, ale z czasem kusi coraz bardziej. 

Smak: pełny, słodki z kwaskową i lekko wytrawną kontrą. Czekolada do potęgi - mleczna i gorzka, wiśnie w czekoladzie, a do tego konkretny czekoladowy posmak na finiszu. Raczej wytrawny, z zaznaczoną goryczką. Alkohol jest obecny, ale uaktywnia się dopiero po chwili od przełknięcia, pozostawiając przyjemne ciepło. 

Następne świetne piwo od Mikkellera, zarazem pierwsze degustowane przeze mnie, jakie uwarzył on w Hiszpanii. Tym razem brat Georgea - tj. Brian, Imperialny Porter. Piwo jest Faktycznie czarne, oleista i ma świetną pianę. W aromacie fajerwerków nie ma, choć i tak jest on bardzo przyjemny. W smaku wyraźna pełnia, słodycz oraz czekolada. Wysoki poziom alkoholu nie atakuje, tylko leciutko daje znać o sobie dopiero po krótkiej chwili w postaci ogrzania przełyku. Chwilę trwało zanim dojrzałem do decyzji o zakupie tego piwa, ze względu na jego cenę, jednak nie żałuję. Szkoda jedynie, że tak mało...

Bottled 330ml. -fromSvijet Piva Zagreb. Side by side tasting with George. Pitch oily black coloured, medium sized brown head, chocolate (mousse) in the nose. Heavy roasted malt, dark chocolate, strong licorice, decent hoppy and light alcoholic with roasty finish. Really good brew but than Brian met George...

Bottle. Pours black in color with a tan head. First some dark chocolate and roasted coffee notes hits on the nose. Later some more burnt wooden and ashy notes mixed with salty licorice appears too. Very dark indeed. Bit of sweetness tastewise, but there is present some saltyness and burnt woodyness as well. Coffee and dark chocolate with some bitters in the end. Nice, with minimal sign of the quite high abv.

330ml bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 03-11-2014.
BBD:not found.
In short: robust dark ale.
Pours black with nice very tan head. Modrate head retention, some lacing. Roasty, liquor, coffee, and some burnt caramel, vanilla aromas. High bodied, soft carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is some sweet, viscous mouthfell, roasty, cacao, some spicy, and the really dry and bitter. Quite enjoyable.

Bottle @ Home. Pours pitch black with a creamy brown head, nice lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, berries, some alcohol. Flavor starts rather sweet, malty, chocolate, dark fruits, raisins, bitter black coffee, berries. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Hides ABV well, but shows some alcohol warmt in the finish. 011114

Une bouteille de 33 cl sans date. Une grosse tête sur un liquide noir. Un nez assez brutal de malts brûlés, de chocolat, de petits fruits, deccafé noir, de houblons et de dherbes anisées. Un goût corsé fait de charbon de bois, de café, de caramel calciné avec des houblons citronnés, du chocolat aux noisettes et de fuits en confiture. Une bouche bien ronde avec un pétillement modéré et une texture liquoreuse. Une finale très amère, torréfiée et fumée avec des houblons qui persistent. Costaude. Pas pour les mauviettes.

stor duft af de ristet malt og karamel malt som næsten giver øllet en viniøst duft: 
smag: malt sød, ristet malt. rosin. kaffe. en smule smag af mås/jordslået, stor rastsødme. 
virker som om man måske har forsøgt at bryggen en anden øl. og det gik måske ikke helt efter planen. og så kunne man ikke udgive den med sit normale navn. og der ved man gav den et andet navn. syntes der er en del underlig smage i øllet som jeg ikke bryder mig så meget om 

.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a Snifter. Thank you, Mikkeller for naming this beer after me... Pitch black with a thin, tanned head. Roasted aroma with coffee, chocolate, dark malts, red berries, herbal hops and some booze. Taste is bitter and roasted. Full body with an oily textire and a soft carbonation. Long lasting roasted finish with dark malts and herbal hops. Excellent Porter - a little less booze would have made it even better.

Bottle @ home. Pours black with a beautiful brown head. Aroma is boozy, heavy roasted malt, coffee and tartness. Taste is sweet, liqourice, cherry, dried fruits, roasted malt and coffee. Well balanced, medium body, oily with soft carbonation. Long and tasty bitter roasted finish.

Bottle at home.
Pitch black colored with a huge beige head.
Roasted aroma of dark chocolate, hops, cocoa powder and hops with notes of soap.
Sweet and roasted flavor of caramel and dark chocolate with notes of cocoa powder.
Roasted finish.

Pour pitch black, with a Big n frothy tan head. 
Aroma has a lot going on, licorice, smoke, charcoal, bitter n grassy hops, brown sugar, vanilla on the teeth, burned malts. 
The taste is pretty bitter up front and in the middle, with some sweetness in the back. 
Semi-full bodied, with a semi flat carbonation. This is actually pretty darn tasty. A little harsh, but I guess thats what you want in an imperial porter.
On tap at Salon piva 2014. Pours dark brown color, dark beige head. Aroma is strong coffee, cocoa, chocolate, roasted malt. Taste is extra sweet, coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, plums, blueberries.
Bottle. Pours like oil, black with tan head. Aroma of licorice, molasses, roast, burnt, some bonfire, vanilla. Taste is meaty, like burnt barbeque meat, molasses, char. Thick and bitter. Decent

23-SEP-2014, bottle @home, from Kvickly Allerød.
Black with lasting, lacing, brown head.
Roasted, burnt malt with coffee and coconut.
Sweet, full body with soft carbonation. Bitter and hoppy. Nice:-)

Bottle from Mikkeller Webshop; pitch black pour with a creamy mocha head, coffee an roast malt aroma, taste has burnt roasted malts, dark chocolate, treacle toffee, coffee, a hint of dark fruits, viscous mouthfeel, bitter finish.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2014 Pours black with medium brown head
Aromas of chocolate, coffee, black malts, tar, ash, dark fruits
Taste has ash, coffee, hints of bitter dark chocolate, wee bit caramel sweetness
Palate is thick, creamy, a bit sprizzy, medium to high long bitterness

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a medium kinda bubbly brown head. The aroma is huge dark roasted with licorice and coffee notes. The flavor is sweet deep roasted with a good hoppy bite. Licorice and bitter roasted malt in the finish. Full flavored and full bodied.

Tap at Salon piva. Aroma is strongly roasted, strong coffee, light burnt. Pitch black colour, oily texture, dark brown colour. Taste has lots of roasted, burnt flavour, at the same time a bit too much sweetness and initially a lot of fruitiness. Quite rough around the edges, but overall enjoyable.
Bottle at Salón piva.  Roasted malt, coffee, some tartness. Taste, roasted malt, caramel, dark chocolate, citrus hops. Tasty.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with a little sediment and a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, liquorice, hops, and dark sugar - with a bitter finish.

Bottled. Pours black with an average, creamy and lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, hops, chocolate, coffee and licorice notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with alcohol and bitterness. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. A very nice strong Porter.

33cl bottle stored in the cellar since july, weeks before its release. Pours a tar dark with a stunning frothy dark brown head, beautiful lacing sticks to the glass. Aroma is predominantly wood, oak with hints of marzipan, hop and candi. Malti and some cherry far away. Followed by a surprising taste explosion of sugar cane, licorice, bitters... The slight bitter dies off which is great.. I find the balanced sweetness allows room for the other flavours to express. Lovely how the oaky fumes intertwine with all these flavours. More than lovely!

Bottle at home - thanks to Mette, who shared it with me. Pitch black - big brown head. High malty, high burned malts, bitterness, liquorice, hazelnut oil, nutella, herbal aroma, bitterness, dark chocolate, tarmac, burned sugar, hard burned sugar, toffee, bitter burned, some bitter hoppy notes.
Bottle @ DRBSG14. Black body with a small brown head. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, bitter, hops. Nice.
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, 2014. Pours black with a creamy head and lacings. Coffee, charcoal and roast and chocolate. Full bodied. Warming.

Bottle 330ml @ fonefan
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, orange, coffee and molasses. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long roasted, chocolate, coffee and citrus finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle, 12.3%. Black with medium brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a little liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, medium sweet, hop and bitter.

33 cl bottle. Pours pitch black with a small tan to brown head. Aroma is roasted malty and solid hoppy. Dark roasted malty. Thick malty, roasted and overripe fruity. Dark roasted malty. Liqourice. Bitter and dark malty finish. Somewhat syrupy. Sugarish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Black with a dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee and dark chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. 300814

Bottle. It pours a more or less black body and a dense, dark tan head. The aroma has lots of dark sugars, with chocolate, coffee and a touch of pine cones. Soy sauce, licorice hints and alcohol too. Its full bodied and quite sticky, with a pleasant carbonation and some alcohol warmth. The flavor is sweet, with resiny, piney hops and hoppy bitterness, as well as dark chocolate, lots of coffee and some molasses hints. Lasting finish with a good bitterness to deal with the sweetness. Wonderful indeed. 140830
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, licorice, chocolate, caramel and hops.
